articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's military prepared for ground operations in Gaza to root out the Hamas militant group, whose deadly rampage through Israeli border towns last week stunned the nation.
articles.title: Israel and Hamas at war: Latest news

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The fighting between Israel and Hamas, which launched a surprise attack on Saturday, is the latest in seven decades of war and conflict between Israelis and Palestinians that has drawn in outside powers and destabilised the wider Middle East.
articles.title: What's the Israel-Palestinian conflict about and how did it start?

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. and Israelis officials are discussing the possibility of a visit to Israel soon by U.S. President Joe Biden at the invitation of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, a source familiar with the matter said on Sunday.
articles.title: US, Israelis discussing potential Biden visit to Israel, source says

articles.author: Nandita Bose, Humeyra Pamuk, Steve Holland
articles.description: The United States is bolstering its firepower in the Middle East to prevent the spread of the conflict between Israel and Palestinian militant group Hamas and deter Iran from getting involved as international fears of a wider regional war grow.
articles.title: US will send a second aircraft carrier to the eastern Mediterranean

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said on Sunday that the Egyptian-controlled border crossing into Gaza would reopen and the US was working with Egypt, Israel and the United Nations to get assistance through it.
articles.title: Egypt pushes to break impasse over Gaza aid

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: As Israel intensified air strikes on the Hamas-controlled Gaza Strip and told residents to move south towards the border with Egypt, some like father of six Fadi Daloul thought that would be a safe option and gathered up his belongings.
articles.title: Palestinians fleeing fighting to the south find no escape from danger

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas said the actions and policies of Islamist group Hamas do not represent Palestinian people, according to official news agency WAFA.
articles.title: President Abbas says Hamas' actions do not represent Palestinians

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk, Nandita Bose, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: An Egyptian-controlled border crossing into Gaza is expected to reopen amid diplomatic efforts to get aid into the Hamas-controlled strip that has been under intense Israeli bombing since the group's rampage that killed 1,300 people that killed 1,300 people on Oct. 7.
articles.title: Gaza border crossing set to reopen as Israeli troops prepare ground assault

articles.author: Kevin Buckland
articles.description: Crude oil hovered above $90 a barrel while equities were weak and the safe-haven dollar was firm on Monday as investors nervously watched for whether escalating violence in Gaza would cause the conflict to spread beyond Israel and Hamas.
articles.title: Nervous markets eye Gaza as oil hovers above $90

articles.author: Karen Freifeld
articles.description: The U.S. will take steps to prevent American chipmakers from selling products to China that circumvent government restrictions, a U.S. official said, as part of the Biden administration's upcoming actions to effectively block more AI chip exports.
articles.title: Exclusive: Upcoming US rules on AI chip exports aim to stop workarounds
